page.title: 19Sunderland Hall Farm.
page.content: This farm is about 260 acres in size. The farmhouse is a listed building and dates from Tudor times. The farm was purchased 40 years ago. The present owner is Mr Smith who is a Governor of Stratton School. Cereals and vegetables are grown on the farm. The cereals are grown for seed and chemicals are used to assist growth. The soil on the farm is variable - sands, gravels and clays. In the past one field was used as a tip and it is not uncommon for the farmer to plough up rubbish. The farm employs 6 fulltime workers and 2 part time men during harvesting. The farm has a small resevoir. Elm trees on the farm were removed several years ago because of the Dutch Elm Disease.
